Software for MRI

By MRFIL @ the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign

Open Source Software from MRFIL

We develop tools and acquisition strategies to enable new applications in Magnetic Resonance Imaging. Check out our lab site for more information about who we are and what we do.

Check out our lab

MRFIL is the Magnetic Resonance Functional Imaing Lab in the Beckman Institute at the University of Illinois lead by Brad Sutton.

Read More

Open Source Software

Our code is released primarily under the University of Illinois/NCSA Open Source License, an OSI approved Open Source license.

Read More at OSI

Check us out on GitHub

Find our released projects via our org page on GitHub. Fork code and send us comments or suggestions.

GitHub

PowerGrid

Check out our open source toolkit for accelerating non-Cartesian reconstructions via GPUs and distributed memory computations. To be presented at ISMRM 2016 in Singapore, May 7th-13th, 2016.

Lesion Mapper

Automated software for mapping T2 white matter hyperintensities. Presented as a poster at ISMRM 2015 in Toronto, Canada.

IMPATIENT

Illinois Massively Parallel Acceleration Toolkit. A CUDA based toolkit for Non-Cartesian Reconstruction with GPUs.

For more updates about our research, check out our homepage.

Get in touch

Email us at acerja2 (at) illinois.edu
